decision_conditions: The development to which this permission relates shall be begun not later than the expiration of three years from the date of this permission.

Reason: To comply with Section 91 of the Town & Country Planning Act 1990. | The development hereby approved shall be carried out in accordance with drawing title number(s): Written Scheme of Investigation for an Archaeological Watching Brief dated September 2024, Cut and Fill Analysis Plans dwg. 1000009257-4-0600-01 rev 2, Drainage Construction Details Sheet 1 of 2 dwg. 1000009257-4-0501-01 rev 2, Drainage Construction Details Sheet 2 of 2 dwg. 1000009257-4-0501-01 rev 1, General Arrangement dwg. 1000009257-3-0100-01 rev 2, Site Boundary Plan dwg. 1000009257-3-0000-01 rev 2, Site Location Plan dwg. 1000009257-3-0000-02 rev 2, Proposed Drainage Plan dwg. 1000009257-4-0500-01 rev 5, Proposed Drainage Plan (Site set up plan) dwg. 1000009257-4-0500-01 rev 5, Tree Strategy 1 of 2 dwg. 1000009257-3-3001-01 rev 2, Tree Strategy 2 of 2 dwg. 1000009257-3-3001-02 rev 2, Design and Access Statement V2 dated 08/08/2024, Construction Management Plan and Health and Safety Plan V1.2, Tree Constrains Plan TCP 01.
Reason: For the avoidance of doubt, and in the interests of proper planning.
| The hereby approved scheme shall be in accordance with the approved document Written Scheme of Investigation for an Archaeological Watching Brief dated August 2024.
The start date when known should be communicated by the archaeological practice to Historic England, that will conduct monitoring visits on your behalf.

For land that is included within the WSI, no demolition or development shall take place other than in accordance with the agreed WSI, and the programme for post-investigation assessment and subsequent analysis, publication & dissemination and deposition of resulting material. This part of the condition shall not be discharged until these elements have been fulfilled in accordance with the programme set out in the WSI.
Reason: In order to safeguard the archaeological interest on this site in accordance with policies HC1 of the London Plan (2021), and National Planning Policy Framework (2025).

| Contamination not previously identified, but subsequently found to be present at the site shall be reported to the Local Planning Authority as soon as is practicable. If deemed necessary development shall cease on site until an addendum to the remediation method statement, detailing how the unsuspected contamination is to be dealt with, has been submitted to and approved in writing to the Local Planning Authority (including any additional requirements that it may specify). The development shall then be undertaken in accordance with the approved details. Should no further contamination be identified then a brief comment to this effect shall be required to be submitted to and approved in writing by the Local Planning Authority prior to the first occupation of the development hereby approved.

Reason: To ensure that a satisfactory strategy is put in place for addressing contaminated land, making the land suitable for the development hereby approved without resulting in risk to construction workers, future users of the land, occupiers of nearby land and the environment.

| The development shall be carried out strictly in accordance with the submitted document Construction Management Plan and Health and Safety Plan V1.2 and the approved plan Proposed Drainage Plan (Site set up plan) dwg. 1000009257-4-0500-01 rev 5.
a)	Any works outside the permitted hours shall be notified to and approved by Pollution Control
b)	Noise and vibration should be limited according to Approved CoP BS 5228-1 and -2:2009+A1:2014
c)	Dust shall be controlled according to IAQM (2024) Guidance on the assessment of dust from demolition and construction

Reason: To protect the amenity of occupants and neighbouring properties in accordance with policy 7A and policy 7B of Ealing's Development Management DPD (2013), policies D14 and SI1 of the London Plan (2021), policy 1.1 (j) of the Ealing Development (Core) Strategy (2012) and National Planning Policy Framework (2025).
| Following the completion of works, grass reseeding of the park (where necessary) shall be undertaken within the next available planting season.

Reason: In the interests of protecting the visual amenity of the area, contributing to the quality and character of London's environment, air quality and adapting to and mitigating climate change in accordance with policies G1 and G6 of the London Plan 2021, policy 5.10 of Ealing's Development Management DPD.
| The ground level shall not raise more that 350mm above existing levels across the site.

Reason: In the interests of protecting the visual amenity of the area, contributing to the quality and character of London's environment in accordance with policies G1, G4 and G7of the London Plan , policy 5.10 of Ealing's Development Management DPD.

| No trees, shrubs or hedges within the site which are shown to be retained on the approved plans shall be felled, uprooted, damaged or destroyed, cut back in any way or removed without previous written consent of the Local Planning Authority.

Any shrubs or hedges removed without consent or dying or being severely damaged or becoming seriously diseased within 5 years from the completion of the development hereby permitted shall be replaced with shrubs or hedge plants or similar species capable of achieving a comparable size unless the Local Planning Authority gives written consent to any variation.

Reason: To ensure appropriate tree protection in the interests of protecting the visual amenity of the area, contributing to the quality and character of London's environment, air quality and adapting to and mitigating climate change in accordance with policies G5 and G7 of the London Plan, policy 5.10 of Ealing's Development Management DPD and Ealing's SPG 9 - Trees and Development Guidelines.

| Within 1 month of the works hereby approved, a RoSPA (Royal Society for the Prevention of Accidents) report shall be commissioned. The report shall be provided to the local planning authority and the security measures/recommendations contained within shall be implemented within 6 months of the date of the application hereby approved, and shall be managed and retained as such thereafter.

Reason: To ensure that the safety standards are met and protect the amenity of users in accordance with policy 7B of Ealing's Development Management DPD (2013), policies D2 and D4 of the London Plan (2021), and National Planning Policy Framework (2025).
description: Landscaping, drainage and ground works to enable flood mitigation, reuse/recycle excavated material (between 8000 to 10000 m3) by spreading on existing meadow to establish new wild flower meadow, landscaping works and drainage works to connect existing watercourse to SuDS features to divert flow at restricted rate  (Regulation 3 Application by London Borough of Ealing)

superseding_details.component_description: Reuse/recyle excavated material on existing meadow and reinstate wild flower meadow
